item.title: Exceptional fossils: feathers, soft tissues, and ancient molecules
item.description: Abstract Within the last two to three decades, the field of paleontology has undergone some radical shifts. The application of new analytical equipment and experimental approaches, along with new fossil discoveries, have not only changed our understanding of life in the past, but also how we test hypotheses in a traditionally historical science. In relation to my work, the discovery of exceptionally preserved dinosaur skeletons with feathers has provided new insight into the evolution of birds and flight.
